title: Cabinet ministers children 'scared' by anti-Brexit abuse in the street, says wife of Michael Gove
text:
Michael Gove’s children have been left "scared" by anti-Brexit abuse in the street , his wife revealed yesterday.

Sarah Vine said it was not just Remain politicians who faced flak, citing Saturday’s abuse directed at Commons leader Jacob Rees-Mogg as he and his 12 year old son Peter left Parliament under the protection of a dozen police officers.

“For the son it must have been a frightening experience,” Ms Vine told BBC’s Andrew Marr show. “I have children as well. Occasionally, we do get aggression in the street and it’s quite scary for them.

“He should be able to take his son to Parliament if he wants to and it should be okay for him to come out without being shouted at.”
